fields.description:
Hello Jira,

I need to make spaces visible to all my JSM customers in a document layout with a tree structure.



*The current solutions do not work for my organization:*

+Existing solution 1, anonymous access+:

the space is public and visible to the whole web without restrictions. Nevertheless the layout interests me because it is in the form of a tree structure where the user is free to navigate and choose the page inside.


+Existing solution 2, JSM access+:

the articles are visible only by JSM customers on the customer portal and page by page, which is not at all practical if you want to create the same structure as on the public space. 

I understand the primary use of Confluence is to share internal documentation, but being able to specifically share project documentation to certain customers in a more structured form would be a real asset.

The need would be in short, an external wiki with a tree structure visible only to one or more organizations, one or more JSM projects.


Thank you for your attention,

Adrien Préau
fields.summary: In Confluence space setting, is it planned to be able to link a space to JSM customers permissions?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A new Global Permissions UX was recently released for Confluence Cloud, with several improvements. However, only groups that are granted with product access are shown on the *User groups* tab. Because of this behavior, admins can't manage permissions to create Spaces (both Communal and Personal) for groups that are not being granted with product access.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test group on the Instance administration.
 # Grant Confluence access to this group.
 # Access the Global Permissions on Confluence. 
 # Grant to this group permission to *Create Space*.
 # On the Product Access configuration, revoke Confluence access for this group.
 # Access the Global Permissions on Confluence again. 

h3. Expected Results

The group should still be listed there, so that you can manage global permissions granted to it. 
h3. Actual Results

The group won't be listed in there. 
h3. Workaround

Use the old Global Permissions UX to manage this permissions. This is the link for the old UX:
{code:java}
https://<InstanceName>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/permissions/globalpermissions.action {code}
(on) Don't forget to replace <InstanceName> by your Instance name.
fields.summary: New Global Permissions UX doesn't show groups that don't have product access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some customers who have the [Refined Toolkit for Confluence app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216056/refined-toolkit-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] installed and applied as a theme for spaces are reporting issues upon trying to access spaces using it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Navigate to a Space Overview page with custom theming, then navigate to another Space Overview page with custom theming within the same tab

h3. Expected Results
The first Space Overview page and second Space Overview page to have custom theming applied

h3. Actual Results
The first Space Overview page has custom theming applied and second Space Overview page does not, it renders with the default styling.

h3. Workaround
On the second Space Overview page, refresh the page.
fields.summary: Custom theme on Space Overview page not applied on subsequent Space changes

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 27 July 2021}
Hi everyone,

My name is Sam Ugulava and I'm a Product Manager on the Confluence Cloud team. Thank you for the comments on the current need to enforce file sizes limits in Confluence. We understand this can cause backups to be slow. We are converting this bug to a suggestion ticket while we determine how broadly this problem is impacting customers. You will continue to be able to upvote and track our progress.

Best,
Sam
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Users are able to upload files that are bigger than the configured attachment size limit. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Settings > General Cofigurations
 # Set an Attachment Maximum Size of 1MB
 # Edit a page.
 # Try to upload a 2MB file. 

h3. Expected Results

The attachment size limit should be enforced. 
h3. Actual Results

Files larger than the configured size limit can be uploaded. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editor does not enforce the attachment size limit

fields.description:
Currently, customers are unable to change all the old pages to full-width other than going to each page and changing.

It would be nice to provide a feature that allows them to change all the old pages to full-width after enabling page full-width for new pages other than modifying it page by page.
fields.summary: Ability to change all the old pages to full-width

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to have inline comments, by highlighting some text in the page and saving it, as well replying those inline comments and resolving them by clicking on the button resolve on the inline comment itself.

However, there is some inline comments being resolved without any actions from the users and the following message is displayed:

"Resolved because the text was deleted by"


h3. Steps to Reproduce

It is not possible to reliable replicate this issue, but there is some steps to try replicating this issue:

# Create a page with an expand and publish it
# Make some edits
# User 2 add a comment inside of the expand in view mode
# Publish the page
# See the comment in the expand get resolved


h3. Expected Results
Inline comments untouched upon publishing page.

h3. Actual Results
Some comments are getting resolved


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Inline comments incorrectly deleted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking and selecting to open in a new tab, a new blank page opens with no data loaded and presents an error message:
{quote}Something's gone wrong

Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
 ERROR: E2J4A3
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a confluence page
 2. Find X # of people viewed this page
 3. Click with mouse wheel or right-click open in a new tab
h3. Expected Results

A new page loaded with data from that page analytics
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Something's gone wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
ERROR: XXXXXXXX
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

(on) If you click on X # of people viewed this page, then open "view analytics" in a new tab it does open successfully

When we use a software with multibyte name in Atlassian Companion, the software name is shown with garbled characters.

The software name is displayed correctly.

fields.description:
As per [~tmahule@atlassian.com] suggestion for https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/browse/ED-12548, raising this item here. 

Action is to follow up and work with Confluence migrations and/or ecosystem to incorporate end-to-end tests as part of the migration process. Some simple tests such as:

* Add content to Editor document (including content to be migrated)
* Publish content (trigger the migration)
* Assert renderer can see content and is correct
* Reopen page in editor, assert can see content and is correct
fields.summary: PIR Improvement Action - Add End-to-end of Editor migrations to migration processes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The page https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SWAN/pages/186433828/ICSE+2018+notes used to have a lot of images. Now all except one are gone. Can you help me get my images back?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Browse to the page https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SWAN/pages/186433828/ICSE+2018+notes. Only a single image on the page, there used to be a lot more.

Notes:
1. This page is using the old editor.
2. Last week I moved this page from one space to another, could be related? Another page that I moved (linked below) didn't have any similar issues, but that page is on the new editor.

h3. Expected Results
I expect to see a lot of images on the page. Check out https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~afriedman/pages/464222387/ICSE+2019+notes to see what I mean.

h3. Actual Results
I see only a single image on the page, where are the rest?


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Viewing a page on Confluence (Hello) and all images except one are gone

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Confluence collaboration team was unaware that a change was being released to affect mentions. Having this in place could have allowed better and faster response to the HOT.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

NA
h3. Expected Results

Confluence teams have clear understanding of all Atlaskit changes being made to features they are owned.
h3. Actual Results

It is not always clear to Confluence feature owners when exactly new changes to features under their umbrella are getting updates from Atlaskit.
h3. Workaround

Manually reviewing each documented version bump from the TWP release train and checking all tickets to see if they affect any of your teams features.
fields.summary: PIR [PIR-8916] Action item - Explore better ways to notify Confluence feature owners when Atlaskit changes may affect their team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an application link between a Confluence Cloud and a Jira Server instance that uses a Let's Encrypt certificate, Confluence won't be able to connect to the server instance and it's not possible to create the ink.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to create an application link between a Confluence Cloud instance and a Jira server one using a Let's Encrypt certificate

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to create an application link

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown in the UI:
| !app_link.png|thumbnail! |
And this error is logged internally:
{code:none}com.atlassian.applinks.spi.manifest.ManifestNotFoundException: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target{code}

h3. Workaround
At this time, the available workaround is to use a different certificate.
fields.summary: Let's encrypt certificate is not being accepted by Confluence Cloud for application links with a server instance

fields.description:
Using the ability to embed Jira Work Management "forms" in Confluence pages, users can view and submit forms without needing direct access to Jira.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, the Jira Work Management "form" can be inserted by using the [iFrame macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-iframe-macro/] with the following steps:
 # In Jira Work Management, access a project and [create a form|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/collect-information-with-forms/]
 # Once the form is properly configured, tap the *Share* button and select the *Copy Link* option
 # Now, go to Confluence and create a new page
 # While editing this page, add the [iFrame macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-iframe-macro/]
 # On the iFrame macro configuration, paste the copied URL into the *URL* field of the macro.
 # Save the configuration and publish the page.

(i) For a good rendering size, make sure to adjust the width and height of the iFrame macro (while configuring it).
fields.summary: Ability to embed Jira Work Management "forms" in Confluence pages
Sometimes the request to create a full-width page through the API returns a 400

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After renaming a space via a REST API call, the space reference in the search results shows the space name before a rename.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new space called "[TEMP PREFIX] Test Cache Space 1"
{code:java}
curl --request POST \
  --url '<instance>/wiki/rest/api/space' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
"key": "TPTCS1",
"name": "[TEMP PREFIX] Test Cache Space 1"
}' \
--user <email>:<token>{code}
 

2. Copy a page to the new space

 
{code:java}
curl --request POST \
  --url '<instance>/wiki/rest/api/content/<sourcePageId>/pagehierarchy/copy' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
"copyAttachments": true,
"copyPermissions": true,
"copyProperties": true,
"copyLabels": true,
"destinationPageId": "<targetSpaceHomePageId>"
}' \
--user <email>:<token>
{code}
3. Rename the space to "Test Cache Space 1"

 

 
{code:java}
curl --request PUT \
  --url '<instance>/wiki/rest/api/space/TPTCS1' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
"name": "Test Cache Space 1" 
}' \
--user <email>:<token>
{code}
 

 
h3. Expected Results

The search results show the renamed space as space name so "Test Cache Space 1" in our example.
h3. Actual Results

The search results show the space name before the rename.

The screenshots show that the space name is "[TEMP PREFIX] Test Cache Space 1" in both the quick search and the advanced search results:

!SearchResults_SpaceRename1.png|width=330,height=146!

!SearchResults_SpaceRename2.png|width=327,height=154!
h3. Notes

The same steps performed in the UI will show the renamed space name in the search results.

This happens because the space name is indexed at the page level so a re-index of the pages is required for the space name to be updated. This explains why, after modifying a page, a new search will show the correct space name.
h3. Workaround

No workaround is currently available.
fields.summary: Pages in renamed spaces show the previous name in search results when a rename is performed via the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Text file or .msg file attachments can't be downloaded while image/video can from page view mode by right clicking on it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add text file or .msg file to a page
 # Publish the page.
 # Right click on the file and try to save with *Save as* option.
 # Observe that it results in prompt to save the page as opposed to the file.

h3. Expected Results

The file attachment should have been saved similar to that for image/video attachments.
 !image-2021-05-12-15-22-12-508.png|width=219,height=177!
h3. Actual Results

With right click on the txt or msg attachments, choosing the *Save as* option, prompts to save the page instead.
 !image-2021-05-12-15-20-57-889.png|width=229,height=142!
h3. Workaround

Attachments can be downloaded from the attachment list or from attachment preview mode.
fields.summary: Right click "Save as" Text file or .msg file attachments can't be downloaded

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images in Page Properties macros are too big when the Page Properties Report macro calls them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Page Properties macro to a page, create a table, and in one of the cells, add a large image. Add a test tag to the page.
 # On a new page, add the Page Properties Report macro, and refer to the tag you created in the macro settings. Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The images display the same size they did on the Page Properties macro page.
h3. Actual Results

The image displays much larger than it appears on the Page Properties macro page.

!image-2021-05-12-09-44-11-373.png|width=571,height=339!
h3. Workaround

Resize the images in the Page Properties macro tables (as in the attached video example).
fields.summary: Image dimension is huge in Page Properties macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For devices on API 28 and older, viewing a page in dark mode does not render the page in dark mode. The page is rendered in light mode while every other component of the app (buttons, text, toolbar, etc.) is rendered in dark mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the Confluence Android app on an Android device with API 28 or older.
 # Turn dark mode on.
 # View a page.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be shown in dark mode.
h3. Actual Results

The page is shown in light mode. Everything else on the screen (comments, toolbar, some buttons and text) is shown in dark mode.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages are not correctly rendered on Dark Mode on Android devices with API 28 or older

fields.description:
Currently, when the user middle clicks the create button, nothing happens. Ideally, when middle clicking this create button, the editor should be opened with a new draft in a new browser tab.

!Screen Shot 2021-05-11 at 2.28.55 PM-1.png|width=434,height=34!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Large Confluence pages scroll/jump around while editing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try importing a large Word document that contains images.

 # Edit this document

h3. Expected Results

Selection and scroll remain predictable.
h3. Actual Results

Selection jumps around the document and scrolls away from where the user wanted to edit.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Large documents scroll / jump when editing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the previous version of Team Calendars, when accessing our calendars (/wiki/mycalendar), we could click individual calendars and that would take us to their individual view.

In the new version, nothing happens when clicking the calendar's name.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement this option back to Team Calendars
fields.summary: Team calendar no longer have single calendar view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When working configuring [Google drive macros|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-google-drive-macro/], it will require the URL of the file to be added so it can be previewed and added to the page.

If the user adds the link of the file without the "edit" part of the URL, although it will be previewed while editing the page, the macro will be converted into a link once the page gets published.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page and edit it.
 # While editing the page, insert the [Google Drive macros|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-google-drive-macro/].
 # While configuring the macro, make sure to add the URL of the file (without the "edit" part). For example:
{code:java}
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/id-of-the-sheet
{code}

(i) This happens with sheets, docs, and slides.
h3. Expected Results

The file should be rendered on the published page.
h3. Actual Results

The macro gets converted to an URL:

!google_bug.gif!
h3. Workaround

Add the full URL including the "/edit" part. For example:
{code:java}
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/ID-of-the-sheet/edit#gid=0{code}
fields.summary: Adding links to the Google Drive apps configuration will convert them into URLs

fields.description:
Enable the Office PowerPoint macro to displays presentations in an interactive viewer with next and back buttons like in a server/DC version. 
!image-2021-05-07-23-51-22-901.png|width=104,height=107!
fields.summary: Display presentations using the Office Powerpoint Macro with an interactive player like in the server/DC version

It would be nice to allow our customers to add restrictions on Topics creation, like having a feature that ensures the maintenance and management of Topics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Disable Likes for Comments is not working

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Confluence Admin.
 # Click further *Further Configuration*.
 # Disable *Likes*.  (+_It states:_+ Enabling this will allow users to like pages, blogs, *comments*, and other content.)

h3. Expected Results
It should remove the like button for comments as well.

h3. Actual Results

It does not remove the like button for comments on the page.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disable Likes for Comments is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The [Adaptavist|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/vendors/81/adaptavist] team has some cool macros in the *Content Formatting Macros* add-on that can improve the experience we have on Confluence.
Though, seems like we are not able to change the alignment of some of its macros, as Confluence doesn't allow us to do that.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to install the third-party add-on [Content Formatting Macros for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/247/content-formatting-macros-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview];
# Create a new page and insert the *Button Hyperlink* macro;
# Try to center-align it.

h3. Expected Results
We are able to choose the alignment we want for this macro.

h3. Actual Results
The alignment options are greyed out.

*Notes*
* Working with the Adaptavist team, we were able to note that it is possible to change the alignment changing the CSS in the page, inserting:
{code:css}display: table;
margin: 0 auto;{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Button Hyperlink macro (from Content Formatting Macros for Confluence) cannot be aligned

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images appear small when compared to original size in edit page mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # the image shows small when compared to the actual size

h3. Expected Results

The image uploaded should be of the original size
h3. Actual Results

Images appear small when compared to the original size in edit page mode
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

After publishing the page and refreshing the images show up as original size.
fields.summary: Images appear small when compared to original size in edit page mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some customers who have the [Refined Toolkit for Confluence app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216056/refined-toolkit-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] installed and applied as a theme for spaces are reporting issues upon trying to access spaces using it.

(i) This happens only with specific users in specific instances. Atlassian and Refined are not able to reproduce the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install the [Refined Toolkit for Confluence app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216056/refined-toolkit-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
# Change the space settings and apply it as a theme (through *Space settings* > *Look and feel* > *Themes*)
# Tap *Confirm* so the theme will be applied
# Have a user accessing the space.

h3. Expected Results
The space home page should be rendered properly.

h3. Actual Results
The following issue is displayed:

!Snag_error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Affected users can temporarily revert to using the default Confluence `/wiki/spaces/choosetheme.action?key=SPACE`
fields.summary: Refined Toolkit theme is producing errors for specific users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user doesn't have access to the Overview page (restricted), they will not be able to archive the space when going to *Space Settings > Archive space*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space.
 # Restrict the Overview page so that only you can see it.
 # With a different user, go to *Space Settings > Archive space* (make sure you have permission to do so)
 # Click on the Archive space button.

h3. Expected Results

The space should be archived.
h3. Actual Results

You will get a message saying the space was successfully archived, but it actually wasn't. By accessing the Space Details, the status of the space still appears as *Current*.
h3. Workaround

It is possible to archive the space through the Space Details section:
 # Click *Edit Space Details* link.
 # Change the *Status*  field from “Current” to “Archived.”
 # Hit *Save*.
fields.summary: Users cannot archive spaces if they don't have access to the overview page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With the recent changes we applied on the way that the Anonymous Access works on Confluence (see the details [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30161], it now allows us to let unlicensed but logged in users to be able to access public spaces.

Apparently, we are experiencing an issue that doesn't allow the anonymous user to access the space, redirecting him/her to a request access screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With [SAML SSO|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/configure-saml-single-sign-on-with-an-identity-provider/] set up, navigate to *Site Administration > Site Access* and set your domain to be approved there, so users from that domain can join your site automatically;
# Make sure you do not grant Confluence access for new users on *Site Administration > Product Access*;
# Set your Confluence site and space with [anonymous access|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/] - for the space, just the *view* permission is enough;
# Using a testing account under your approved domain, log in to https://id.atlassian.com/;
# Make sure to have a link to a page from the space that is open for anonymous and access it with this user.

h3. Expected Results
As the settings allow Anonymous Access, the user should be redirected to the page.

h3. Actual Results
The user falls under an access request screen, which was not supposed to happen.

*Note*:
* The user is able to access it for one time, but after the current browser session gets expired, if the user tries to access it again, or even another page, using a direct link, this unexpected behavior will happen.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Anonymous users getting access request for a public space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Removed site users are not able to access anonymous content.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable anonymous access on site
 # Access any page ( where anonymous access is enabled ) through any test account which was never a part of the site  ( it will work as anonymous access is enabled)
 # Now invite the same test user to the site
 # login through the test user account
# Remove this user account 
# try to access the same page from this test account 

h3. Expected Results

Page content should be visible as user is not a part of this site anymore and anonymous access is enabled
 
h3. Actual Results

The message appears “you don’t have access to the site” Request access.

h3. Workaround
Access the anonymous content in private mode
fields.summary: Removed site users are not able to access anonymous content

fields.description: While it's possible to copy, cut, and paste rows and columns by using keyboard shortcuts, being able to drag and drop would be a great improvement: [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-formatting-to-your-page/.|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-formatting-to-your-page/]
fields.summary: Allow drag and drop to move table rows and columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When selecting a page content wich contains text and images, the image is not selected along with the text

This makes it harder when copying the page content and pasted it on an MS Word document or Google Docs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that contains text and image
 # Selected the page content using mouse or cmd+a(macOS) or ctrl+a(Windows)
 # copy the content
 # Paste it on a Word or Google Docs

h3. Expected Results
The text and images should be pasted on the new document

h3. Actual Results
Only the text is pasted

h3. Workaround
 # Right-Click on the image
 # Hit "Copy Image"
 # paste it on the new document.
fields.summary: Images are Not Selected Along with text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is unclear what steps should be taken for a developer manually updating atlaskit components for inclusion in Confluence builds. We need to create and distribute documentation for this.

See PIR: https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/COL/pages/1100535005/Incident+review+for+HOT-95106
h3. Steps to Reproduce

See linked PIR
h3. Expected Results

Developers follow a standard process for manual package bumps that introduces as little risk as possible into production flow.
h3. Actual Results

The current flow does not include the intensive regression pass that happens when a major train release happens for atlaskit changes. There is no standard flow at all
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: PIR [PIR-8916] Action item - Create process doc for updating Atlaskit packages outside of release train flow

See linked PIR

Test will fail when pages with >90 mentions are not loading properly
h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we try to copy about 400 to 500 pages to a new space, we get the error message "An error has occurred. Please try again later" displayed.

Besides that, the pages are successfully copied to the new space but the error message is always displayed at the end of the process.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a parent page with at least 400 to 500 child to pages,
 # Try to copy it into a new space
 # Do not change the titles
 # Hit the copy button
 # Wait until the error is displayed

h3. Expected Results
Displayed a message informing that all the pages have been copied to the new space

h3. Actual Results
Get the error "an error has occurred. Please try again letter" at the end of the process but the pages are always copied successfully

*Notes*:
* It may also happen on page tress with more than 200 pages.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error displayed when trying to copy too many pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Content by Label macro, accordingly to our documentation, it is possible to have up to 500 pages results on the macro, if we use the filter *Maximum number of pages*.
 However, currently the page results are limited to 250.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space and add at least 255 pages there
 # Label all pages with the same label, e.g: test
 # On a new page, insert the content by label macro
 # Filter it to show only the test label
 # Filter the *maximum number of pages* up to *500*
 # Preview and Save.

h3. Expected Results

All the pages would show up.
h3. Actual Results

Only 250 pages are shown. If you have more than 300 or 400 pages, the results are the same.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Content by Label macro maximum pages displays only 250 results and should be up to 500

fields.description:
Search results macro should be available to fabric editor:
Customer use case: They are trying to create a table in Confluence with specific set of issues from Jira and see if there is a corresponding confleunce page those issues are mentioned on and the search results macro is not available.

To learn more about page to blog conversion check out this [article|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Convert-any-page-to-a-blog-in-Confluence/ba-p/1668198].)

fields.description:
Implement a feature that would allow users to configure some updates or notifications for specific pages, to be sent automatically according to the customer's pre-defined(daily, weekly, etc...)

The customer should be able to configure it to be sent to individual users or groups. the customer should also be able to edit the notification content that will de send.
fields.summary: Automatic Notifications sending

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing the alignment of our content is something we need on a daily basis when creating our articles in Confluence. Besides it allows us to let our content arranged in the best way, depending on what we are creating, it helps us to have better visibility of what that page is telling us.
Apparently, some bodied macros (like Panels, Code Snippets, Excerpts) cannot get their alignment change, but they use the own page's width to set it up.

h3. Suggestion
* Allow bodied macros to have their own width configuration button like the page has (center, wide, and full width), so this way we can play with their alignment properly to display the content we are creating.
fields.summary: Cannot change the alignment of bodied macros

# Add a code snippet to a page;
# Add the following code and publish the page
{code:none}-- XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXX XXXXXX XX XXXX XXX
XXXXXX
	X.XX, X.XXXXXXX, X.XXXXXXX, X.XXXX, X.XXXXXXXXXXXXXX, XX.XXXXXXXXX, XX.XXXXXXXXXX, XX.XXXXX, XX.XXXXXX, XX.XXXXXXXX, X.XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX, X.XXXXXXXXXXXXXX, X.XXXXXXXXXX, X.XXXXXXXXXXXXXX, 
	X.*,
	XX.*,
	XXX.*,
	XX.*
XXXX [XXXXXXXXXXXXXX_XXX].[XXX].[XXXX] X
    XXXXX XXXX [XXXXXXXXXXXXXX_XXX].[XXX].[XXXXXXXX] XX XX XX.XX = X.XX XXX XX.XXXXXXX = X.XXXXXXX XXX XX.XXXXXXX = X.XXXXXXX
	XXXXX XXXX [XXXXXXXXXXXXXX_XXX].[XXX].[XXXXXXXXX] XXX XX XXX.XX = X.XX XXX XXX.XXXXXXX = X.XXXXXXX XXX XXX.XXXXXXX = X.XXXXXXX
	XXXXX XXXX [XXXXXXXXXXXXXX_XXX].[XXX].[XXXXX] XX XX XX.XXXXXX = X.XX XXX XX.XXXXXXX = X.XXXXXXX
XXXXX X.XXXXXXX XX ('XXXX')
XXX X.XXXXXX = 0
XXX X.XXXXXXX = 'XXX'
XXX X.XXXXXXXXXXXXXX XXX XX ('X00','X00','X00','X00','X00')										--XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX XXXXXXXXXX XXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXX
XXX X.XX XXXX ('XXX%'
XXX X.XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX = 0
XXX (XX.XXXXXX = 0
XX XX.XXXXXXXX > 0)
XXX XX.XXXXXXXXXX < '00' XXX XX.XXXXXXXXXX > '0'
XXX XX.XXXXXXXXX < 000
XXX XX.XXXXXXXXX XX ('XXXXX0000')
XXXXX XX XX.XXXXXXXXX XXXX, XX.XXXXXXXXXX XXXX;{code}
# Edit the page again and type inside of the macro

h3. Expected Results
The code should be rendered normally

h3. Actual Results
Some parts of the code will be rendered in front of other parts:
 [^CONFCLOUD-72084.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Using spaces instead of tabs won't cause this issue.
fields.summary: Code with tabs will make text to overlap while editing the code snippet macro

fields.description:
h3.Summary

By default, Confluence has the [API for restrictions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content-restrictions/#api-group-content-restrictions] so the users can update and remove restrictions from pages that they have access to. However, this API will not work if the user does not have access to the page(s), even if the user is a space admin.

h3.Suggestion

When the users able to see and change the restricted pages are no longer in Confluence, there is the need to remove such restrictions so they can be later changed.

Similar to how the *Restricted pages* function for space admins work, (see *View all restricted pages in a space* in [Add or remove page restrictions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions/]), this is a suggestion to have an API to remove restrictions as space admin even for pages that the admin does not have access to.
fields.summary: API to remove restrictions without having access to the page(s)

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Add the ability to hide the page tree from the sidebar of a space. Currently, the only way to achieve that would be to reorder the pages so they will not be under the Overview page. 

The workaround is not always the best option, since whenever you access a page that is in a hierarchy other than the overview page, all pages appear again in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Add an option to remove the page tree of a space from its sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While it is possible to create jira issues from the viewing mode, it is not possible to create jira issues from within the editor, as the pop up will only show up the comment option, but not the create issue on the edit mode when highlighting the text.

Accordingly to our documentation, [Use Jira and Confluence together|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-jira-and-confluence-together/], this should be possible to be done from within the editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page and add some text
 # Click on the pencil button to enter the edit mode
# Highlight the text on edit mode

h3. Expected Results
The create issue appears on the highlighted text in edit mode.

h3. Actual Results
The create issue appears only when highlighting the text in viewing mode.

h3. Workaround
Create the issue on the view mode, as it is not available on the edit mode currently.
fields.summary: Unable to create Jira issue when highlighting text from within the editor

fields.description:
Currently, you can use the [Get Content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-api-content-get] REST API endpoint to view the status of a page that's been archived via the Web UI, and can see the status is _archived_, but there is no way to set that status via the REST API.

The [Update Content endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-api-content-id-put] REST API endpoint allows the status of a page to be set to three values: _current, trashed, historical_ or _draft_, but not _archived_.  If you attempt to set the status as archived, the REST API returns a 200 response that infers the page status was updated, but it actually isn't, and the page retains the existing status.
fields.summary: Add ability to archive page via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a Premium/Enterprise subscription, you can create [a Sandbox|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-product-sandboxes/] based on your production tenant. On the Org administration, admins are able to trigger a data copy, which should copy all data from the production tenant, to the sandbox. However, restricted pages won't be copied over, and this can result in some failures on the process.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While logged to a different account, create a page on Confluence Cloud.
 # Apply page restrictions on it, so that you are the only user able to view it. 
 # Now, log as the Org admin account (which don't have access on this page). 
 # Access the Org administration.
 # Click on *Products*, on the top navigation bar.
 # Click on *Sandbox*, on the sidebar.
 # Create a Sandbox, if you don't have one.
 # Trigger the data copy.

h3. Expected Results

As the data copy was triggered by an admin, it is expected that all content is copied over (as when you trigger a Space/Site export, which includes restricted content).
h3. Actual Results

Restricted content won't be copied over. Besides, this could cause some failures on the process of copying content that you have access to.
h3. Workaround

If you need to copy a particular Space to the Sandbox, you can still manually export it from the Production tenant, and them import it on the Sandbox one.
fields.summary: Copy data to sandbox will fail to copy restricted pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page, by pasting the share link got from the advanced roadmap for Jira for the Confluence page embedding, it shows the macro as expected, but upon publishing it published only a link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Go to the advanced roadmap in Jira and click on Share button
 # Get the link to share it on Confluence
 # Paste the link directly on the Page or insert the macro by typing /advanced and paste the link on the macro
 # Preview it and Save/insert
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The macro is visible on the published page

h3. Actual Results
The macro only works in edit mode, on published mode it is showing the link instead.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmap Macro on Confluence not working on published page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New tables editor does not let adding a row at the top of a table above 1st row(heading row).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a table on a page
 # click on the + sign again the top Row, and it would let you add
 # we can add row start from 2 row

h3. Expected Results

adding row at the top of first should be allowed/possible
h3. Actual Results

Cannot add new row on top of first row in the table 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Delete the topmost (Heading row) and then you can add a row on top of the first row.
fields.summary: New tables editor does not let adding row at the top of a table above 1st row.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a new user views the page, Confluences automatically watches the page. When the user tries to deselect the watch and reload the page, they are automatically added as a watcher again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

This issue is difficult to reproduce, but we have seen it on new site imports and newly created users so far.
h3. Expected Results

The intended behavior is that you only watch a page in Confluence by interacting with it. e.g., comments, page edits, etc.
h3. Actual Results

Refreshing the page watches the page automatically.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. We will include a workaround here when available.

The problem seems to resolve on its own after some time.
fields.summary: Page automatically watched when user visits the page (without contributing)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When space is created via REST API, that space sometimes doesn't get a homepage created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Keep creating spaces using {{/wiki/rest/api/space?expand=space.homepage}} API endpoint.
h3. Expected Results

Every space has a homepage.
h3. Actual Results

Eventually returned space object won't have {{homepage}} property. Check out that space in UI – there will be no homepage either. It will never be created, i.e. this is not a side effect of asynchrony of some actions but rather a bug.

 

I was able to reproduce this issue twice in ~3000 requests with a simple sequential script.
h3. Workaround
 * Fetch the homepage template using {{GET /wiki/rest/api/template/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-default-space-content-plugin:spacecontent-global}}
 * Create a page using that template using {{POST /wiki/rest/api/content}}
 * Set that page as space homepage using {{PUT /wiki/rest/api/space/<key>}}

Given the workaround requires three extra steps, I've set severity to major.
fields.summary: Creating a space occasionally doesn't create its homepage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When site back up is imported to another site or Sandbox we noticed two behavior
 - UI end - Chat Notification permission gets added to space permissions which was not there in the space while taking backup.
 - When permissions are inspected through REST API using endpoint
{code:java}
https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/space/SPACEKEY?expand=permissions
{code}

It gives two administrator permissions with different IDs
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In your test site, just add administrator group permission and yourself to individual group with view and admin
 # Remove chat notification permissions from the space permissions page.
 # Now, Create a site back
 # Import it to another test site/Sandbox
 # Open the space in the destination site and inspect space permissions in both UI and using the REST API call
{code:java}
https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/space/SPACEKEY?expand=permissions
{code}

h3. Expected Results

It should import the permissions as it is.
h3. Actual Results
 - It shows up Chat notifications on imported space.
 - On inspecting the space permissions using REST API, results in duplicate permissions of the Administrator group with two different ids
{noformat}
"type": "group",
              "name": "administrators",
operation": "administer",
  "targetType": "space"
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Site backup import - inspecting space permission using REST API gives duplicate administrator group permissions - administer space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is possible to preview video files on Confluence Cloud, in the fabric editor and also on the legacy editor.
Videos with >50MB failed to be previewed where else smaller MP4 videos can be previewed without any issue in the legacy editor. 
However, uploading the video on the page and inserting the Multimedia Macro works to preview the same file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in the legacy editor
 # Upload a .mp4 file with 10MB or less on the page for example
 # Upload a .mp4 file with 50MB or more in the same page
 # Insert the multimedia macro and use it to preview the 50MB+ .mp4 file
 # Click on the play/preview for both files and the macro
 


h3. Expected Results
Both videos will preview the video files uploaded on the page, same goes for the macro.

h3. Actual Results
Only the video .mp4 50MB+ displays the message "Can't preview" and after some minutes "preview is on your way"

h3. Workaround
The same video and also larger .mp4 files (200MB) were uploaded and previewed without any problems on the fabric (new) editor.
fields.summary: Videos in legacy editor takes a while to preview with the message "preview is on your way"

fields.description: Create a "convert" option for the default Global templates that use the legacy editor to the new editor,

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Originally suggested on [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/can-we-listen-to-our-own-macro-removal-events-in-page-edit/47073]

 
{quote}We are trying to render a component in a [webpanel|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/web-panel/] by specifying some [conditions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/connect-conditions/] for it such that, the component should only render if a content property exists or is truthy.
 We can set this content property key value to {{true}} upon inserting the macro to the page but if the macro is being remove from the page during Page edit, we need to unset or set the content property value to false so the conditions would work in our favour.

At the moment, I don’t see any way of listening to events when a macro is removed from the page.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. No known webhook exists for listening to when a Macro is removed from a page in page edit mode.
h3. Expected Results

 

To be able to listen to events fired when a macro is removed from a page.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to listen or know when a macro was removed from a page
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

A developer has reported that the Confluence search API intermittently returns BadRequestException for valid CQL.

The following two errors occur:

"com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: CQL was parsed but the search manager was unable to execute the search." "com.atlassian.confluence.search.searchnsmarts.rest.SSSearchClientException: There was an illegal request passed to S&S Content Search API"

 # Steps to reproduce are not clear, other than calling the search API with valid CQL repeatedly until the error occurs.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Created vs Resolved* gadget, there is an option to change the width of the gadget after inserting it to a page.

If the width is configured to reduce its size (I.E. 200px), the gadget configuration options will be hidden during the macro editing's preview.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While editing a page, insert the *Created vs Resolved* gadget
 # Reduce the width of the gadget to be something around 200px
 # Select a valid filter from Jira and apply any desired configuration.
 # Save the gadget's configuration.
 # Edit the gadget's configuration again while still editing the page (cog icon > edit at the bottom right of the gadget's preview)

h3. Expected Results

The configuration fields should be displayed and adapted to the reduced width.
h3. Actual Results

The configuration is hidden. A gif has been recorded to demonstrate the issue:

  !size_gadget.gif|width=796,height=486!
h3. Workaround

Use the "Tab" key from the keyboard to reach the desired fields and save the configuration.
fields.summary: Reducing the width of the "Created vs Resolved" will not display the gadget configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Created vs Resolved* gadget to add information from a filter of Jira, it will be necessary to select a configuration and then, tap the *Save* button to display it on the page.

However, after trying to edit the macro again, the *Save* button will no longer be visible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter that will retrieve issues from Jira.
 # While editing a page in Confluence, insert the *Created vs Resolved* gadget
 # Select the filter and change any configuration
 # Tap *Save* under the gadget configuration.
 # Edit the gadget again

h3. Expected Results

The *Save* button for the gadget (not the macro itself) should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The *Save* button is hidden at the bottom configuration, making it not visible to the user. The issue is demonstrated in the gif below (created in a test instance):

  !save_gadget.gif|width=366,height=224!
h3. Workaround

Use the "Tab" key from the keyboard until it hovers the *Save* button.
fields.summary: Saving the "Created vs Resolved" gadget configuration hides the option to save it again

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating Jira issues in bulk from a table in confluence, the sorted order of the table is always used for the order the issues are created in. When the issue links are added back into the table, they are adding in issue-key numerical order back to the unsorted table which causes them to no longer map to their original table row.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 create a table in a confluence page with some data to generate tickets.
 # Step 2 from the page view, sort the table.
 # Step 3 from the sorted table, click some highlighted text to create a Jira issue and switch to the "Create multiple issues from table mode." and create the issues.

h3. Expected Results
The issues are created and mapped to their appropriate rows

h3. Actual Results

The page reloads, un-sorting the table, and the issues are added back in numerical order to the table rows which is now un-sorted.

h3. Workaround

Un-Sort the table prior to generating Jira tickets from the table.
fields.summary: Creating multiple Jira issues from a Table that is sorted will result in mixed up Jira links

fields.description:
On Confluence Cloud, it is possible to share publicly a few pages for users who don't have a Confluence license without having to open the anonymous access to the entire space through the [Public Links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/ge/public-links-979425312.html] feature.

However, this feature still does have the ability to share Blog Posts publicly, only pages.

As many of our users uses the Blog Posts, it would be a good experience being able to share the blog posts the same way it is possible to share the pages through the public links.
fields.summary: Ability to share blog posts with the Public Links

fields.description:

Values of the Select/Cascading Select Custom Field are not displayed in the issue macro.

On Jira side:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a space has empty decisions among its pages, the *decision report* macro may list a lower number of decisions then what was set in the macro's settings.

This happens because that number limits the number of results, but those results include empty decisions, which are not shown in the report.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few pages containing both empty and valid decisions
 # Create a new page and a decision report macro, setting the *Maximum number of decision* parameter to a number lower than the total number of decisions you created.

h3. Expected Results

The macro should return that number of decisions
h3. Actual Results

It will list a lower number of decisions
h3. Workaround

The available workaround is to delete any empty decisions for the entire space.
fields.summary: The decision report macro will list fewer decisions if there are empty decisions in the space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images use low resolution when pages are exported to PDF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert a high-resolution image
# Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
The image should be exported with high resolution
eg.: the page in view mode
| !Screen Shot 2021-04-26 at 7.36.28 PM.png|thumbnail! |

The image exported will have lower resolution
eg.: the same page exported to PDF
|  !Screen Shot 2021-04-26 at 7.36.41 PM.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently, the available workaround is to copy the original image from the computer and paste it to the page without resizing it.
fields.summary: Exporting pages to PDF will use lower resolution for images

fields.description:
Our team is finding the search difficult to use and are resorting to using google docs instead of using Confluence. The issue is the ease of limiting the search to 
 # a particular space
 # a particular type -> usually a page
 # excluding key words

Using the drop downs to select the first two are clunky - especially because we get logged out of Confluence after an hour and have to redo the selections.

Perhaps a search filter can be saved that remembers the selections yet allows the user to update the search keyword?

Please feel free to reach out to me to discuss.
fields.summary: Remember or give quick select buttons when doing search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding the Jira issues macro to display information from a Next-gen project in a Confluence page, the data from the custom fields don't appear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*In Jira*
 # Create a next-gen project in Jira.
# Create a custom field to an issue type.
# Create new issues using this issue type.
# Populate the custom field.

*In Confluence*
# Create a page.
# Add the Jira issue macro to the page.
# Select the issues you have just created in Jira.
# Under display options, choose the custom field you created previously.

h3. Expected Results
The data from the custom fields should be displayed in Confluence.
h3. Actual Results
The column for the custom fields shows blank in Confluence.
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira issue macro doesn't display data from custom fields created in Next-gen projects

fields.description:
At the moment, permission to create personal spaces is given to each group individually.

Having the option to disable the creation of personal spaces in the entire instance would be ideal for some customers. Therefore, whenever a new group is added to Confluence, it would not be necessary to configure permissions from scratch under Global Permissions.
fields.summary: Create an option for admins to disable the creation of personal spaces globally

fields.description:
When you mention a team on an action item it does not create a task for each member of it, only to the user that has mentioned it.

Expect Results:
When someone mentions a team, Confluence should send a notify to each team member and also create a task on each profile of the team members
fields.summary: Mention a team on the action item does not create a task for each member

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Team Calendars doesn't respect start of week settings

h3. Steps to Reproduce

    # Create a page and add calendar macro
    # Note the start of the day ( as per the language settings) 
    # Now open *Calendars* tab in the left pane for a space 
    # The start day is always sunday

h3. Expected Results
The start date should be same in the Calendars tab and the calendar macro on the page
h3. Actual Results
If you browse to the Calendar section of a Space using the Calendar option in the Space menu on the left hand side, it will not respect the global setting or even the users locale. It seems to always start the week with Sunday.
h3. Workaround

no workaround available for now.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The opening line in the custom content module, [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/custom-content/,] says it "...behaves like built-in Confluence content types—page, blog post, or comment...", however, custom content becomes unavailable after the app that created it is uninstalled.

This behaviour has serious ramifications for apps that are designed to work with each other such as when a partner provides a range of apps with related functionality or perhaps a "lite" and "full" version of an app.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install app foo.
 # Trigger the creation of custom content of type "ac:foo:my-type".
 # Install app bar.
 # Trigger the retrieval by app bar of content of type "ac:foo:my-type" using REST API methods such as [/wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/child\{type}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-api-content-id-child-type-get] and [/wiki/rest/api/search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-search/#api-api-search-get]. 
 # Uninstall app foo.
 # Trigger the retrieval by app bar of content of type "ac:foo:my-type" using REST API methods identified above.

h3. Expected Results

At steps 4 and 6, the content can be retrieved.
h3. Actual Results

At step 6, the content can not be retrieved.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Custom content becomes unavailable after app uninstallation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, the google sheet macro is always defaulting to the first subsheet if there are multiple subsheets.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Google sheet with multiple subsheets. (Screenshot1, Screenshot2)
 # Insert this sheet in a Confluence page using Google sheet macro. Make sure that the URL of any subsheet other than the first subsheet is included here. (Screenshot3)
 # The Google sheet macro always shows the first subsheet instead of the selected subsheet. (Screenshot4)

h3. Expected Results

The Google sheet macro should always show the subsheet based on the URL configured in the macro.
h3. Actual Results

Irrespective of the URL configured the macro always shows the first subsheet by default.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. The user will have to manually navigate to the other subsheets if he wants to see the details here.
fields.summary: In Confluence, the google sheet macro is always defaulting to the first subsheet if there are multiple subsheets.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a link to a bar in the Roadmap Planner macro while viewing the page, if we go to a different page after adding the link, and then get back to that page, the link will disappear until the page is refreshed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page A and add a roadmap planner
# Publish the page
# Click any of the roadmap's bars and add a link to any page
# After the link is added, navigate to any other page and then back to page A
# Click the same bar as you just added the link

h3. Expected Results
The link should be there

h3. Actual Results
The link disappears until the page is reloaded
 [^temporary_cached_link.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Reload the page by using the browser's *Reload this page* button.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner link will disappear after going to a different page and getting back

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While it is possible to see Calendars on a space, by clicking on Calendars in the left sidebar, depending on the timezone set in your Atlassian Account profile preferences, the calendar will return a code error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login into [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 # Set your timezone specific timezones such as PDT8PST or EST5EDT
 # Wait for a few minutes to wait the sync for products/account to take place
 # Go to Confluence, access the Space and click on Calendar

h3. Expected Results

Calendar loads correctly.
h3. Actual Results

After setting the timezone to PDT8PST or EST5EDT, the Calendar returns the code error tied to the time used for the configuration. For example, for PDT8PST:
{code:java}
error: Invalid time zone specified: -07:00
         errorHashCode: <codeerror>
         pageName: SPACE_CALENDARS
         releaseId: CLASSIC-master-6099
         ssrRendered: false
         stack: RangeError: Invalid time zone specified: -07:00
{code}
h3. Workaround

Change the timezone to another one, for example America/Los Angeles for -07:00 or US/Eastern for -04:00.
fields.summary: Depending on the timezone, Team Calendars returns a code error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the [Blog Posts macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-blog-posts-macro/], entries may show the incorrect blog post author. Upon investigation, it appears in situations where the 1st version of a blog post was co-edited.

The author does not match the author displayed on the blog post.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blog post and use the shared draft to collaborate on the post with additional users.
 # Save the blog post, ensuring that version 1 shows as being edited by more than one person.
 # Insert the Blog Posts macro on another page. The author may not match the author according to the blog post.

h3. Expected Results

The blog post author according to the macro should match the blog post.
h3. Actual Results

The incorrect author is displayed for posts co-edited. Blog posts with only one author show the correct author.

Blog posts macro shows {color:#00875a}Person A{color} wrote the blog. (x)
 !blogpostsmacro.png|thumbnail!

The actual blog post shows {color:#de350b}Person B{color} wrote the blog. (/)
 !blogpostitself.png|thumbnail!

The blog post history shows {color:#de350b}Person B{color} wrote the original version, and {color:#00875a}Person A{color} was one of the co-editors of that version. (/)
 !pagehistory.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Workaround

No known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Blog posts macro shows wrong post authors

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Team,

 

there seems to be an inconsistent translation used within Confluence Cloud Administration menu that creates additional confusion related to the import functionality.

The highlighted text refers to importing a whole Confluence Site, though "*Seite* importieren" can also be interpreted as importing a single "Confluence *Page*". 

Therefore, it is suggested to update this translation to "Confluence Site importieren" or "Site importieren" - considering that the term *Site* is already widely used (e.g. referring to the second screenshot or [https://www.atlassian.com/de/software/confluence/guides/get-started/set-up] as examples)

  !image-2021-04-23-16-20-45-845.png!!image-2021-04-23-16-20-29-805.png!
fields.summary: German translation of Site within Administration config menu
